fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As explained in [Workflow Properties|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/workflow-properties-938847526.html], it is possible to add properties to statuses in workflows to change the behavior of a ticket, once a ticket enters this status.

For example, when using the property key *jira.permission.assignable.group*, we can limit the users who can be assigned an issue to only members of a specific group.

The problem is that, since Jira 8.19.1, the property key *jira.permission.assignable.group* is not longer taken into account: instead of only returning users from a particular group in the assignee user picker, all users are listed.

This bug is a regression of the optimized user search which was introduced in Jira 8.19.1 by fixing the 4 bugs listed below:
- [Performance regression in user lookup|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-72101]
- [Searching and Mentioning users may cause performance issues and high CPU load|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-20336]
- [User Picker Dropdown takes an excessive amount of time to load when there are thousands of users in Jira and up to 49 users in the Assignable User permission|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-72581]
- [mention results differ between issue creation and issue view|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-72633]


h3. Environment

Jira 8.19.1 and any higher version.

h3. Steps to replicate

- Install a fresh vanilla Jira 8.19.1 instance
- Create a new Jira project (for example, Jira Core project)
- Create 2 users in the Jira instance, with only 1 user is in the group *jira-administrators*
 !Issue_Replicated1.png|thumbnail! 
- Configure the status "To Do" in the workflow of the Jira Core project with the property key *jira.permission.assignable.group* set to *jira-administrators*
 !Issue_Replicated2.png|thumbnail! 
- Create a new ticket and transition it to the "To Do" status
- Click on the pencil button next to the assignee field

h3. Expected results

Only the user who belongs to the group *jira-administrators* should be listed

h3. Actual results

Users who don't belong to the group *jira-administrators* are also listed:
 !Issue_Replicated3.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

No workaround available
fields.summary: The status property key jira.permission.assignable.group is ignored

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Nested bullets appear differently for custom field and Description field
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a *Text Field (multi-line)* custom field
 # Configure the *Wiki Style Renderer* for this custom field
 #  Add the following text as such (Text Mode) in the custom field:
{noformat}
* Heading 1 asdfghjklqwertyuiopzxcvbnm
** Heading 1.1 asdfghjklqwertyuiopzxcvbnm
** Heading 1.2 asdfghjklqwertyuiopzxcvbnm
*** Heading 1.2.1 asdfghjklqwertyuiopzxcvbnm
*** Heading 1.2.2 asdfghjklqwertyuiopzxcvbnm
* Heading 2 asdfghjklqwertyuiopzxcvbnm
** Heading 2.1 asdfghjklqwertyuiopzxcvbnm
*** Heading 3.2.1 asdfghjklqwertyuiopzxcvbnm{noformat}
 # Switch it to Visual Mode and save
 # Add the same text from step 3 in the description field.

h3. Expected Results

Visually the data will be the same as the text is the same and both fields use Wiki render.

             !image-2021-11-24-12-39-00-784.png|width=395,height=164!
h3. Actual Results

The results of the fields render are different:

!image-2021-11-24-12-40-19-109.png|width=524,height=309!
h3. Workaround


Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Nested bullets appear differently for custom field and Description field

fields.description:
By default, removing an issue from a sprint moves it to the next planned sprint or to the backlog if there isn't another sprint.
As a user, It would be nice to have an option to configure this behavior.
fields.summary: Configure Remove from sprint default behavior

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

The current Resolution-related Endpoints in Jira only allow to fetch information about existing resolutions, but not edit or delete them.

*Reference:* [Jira Server platform REST API reference - Api/2/Resolution|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/8.13.0/#api/2/resolution]
h3. [api/2/resolution|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/8.5.4/#api/2/resolution]
 * [Get resolutions|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/8.5.4/#api/2/resolution-getResolutions] {{GET /rest/api/2/resolution}}
Returns a list of all resolutions.
 * [Get resolution |https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/8.5.4/#api/2/resolution-getResolution]{{{}GET /rest/api/2/resolution/{id{}}}}
Returns a resolution.
h3. Suggested Resolution

Include edit and delete options for the Resolution endpoint.
fields.summary: Provide more REST API endpoints to manage resolutions

fields.description:
h3. Issue

As explained in the documentation [Workflow properties|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/workflow-properties-938847526.html], it is possible to add some properties to workflow status, so that a Jira ticket in that status can behave differently.

For example, when using the property key *jira.permission.assignable.group*, we can limit the users who can be assigned an issue to only members of a specific group.

The problem is that our official documentation does not provide the entire list of these properties and how to use them.

Instead, it has 2 links:
- 1 broken link: https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/latest/com/atlassian/jira/security/WorkflowBasedPermissionManager
- 1 link to a 3rd party website which is only providing some example of keys:
https://www.j-tricks.com/tutorials/permissions-based-on-workflow-status

h3. Suggestion

Create an official documentation that lists all the workflow properties and their usage
fields.summary: Create documentation listing and explaining all the workflow status properties

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Audit log uses default language settings instead of user profile language

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login with Jira administrator account
 # Change default system language to English
 # Change user profile language to non-English language, for example, Portuguese(Brasil)
 # Access audit log

h3. Expected Results

Audit log records are displayed with the user profile language.

h3. Actual Results

Column names are in user language (Portuguese), but record data uses system default (English):

!image-2021-11-23-18-50-10-434.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Display Audit log in user profile language

fields.description:
When looking at a Jira issue's linked items, there are nice summary lists shown directly in the parent organized by the type of link such as relates to, split to, etc. as well as minimal status, priority, and summary.

But when this list of linked items gets long, reviewing the details of each one-by-one is slow, and there's no built-in way to quickly open up a query for these linked issues. Currently, users have to use some powerful plugin such as BigPicture or Structure, or use some aftermarket plugin to specify a search (Powerscripts or Scriptrunner queries such as issuesLinkedAtDepth or linkedIssuesOf) to find the linked issues and open them in a Jira filter. Many users will not have the JQL familiarity to use these powerful tools. 

I noticed sub-tasks already have a helpful option via the three dots menu "Open issue navigator". This is perfect! My request is to extend this similarly to linked issues.

For us, this is necessary for us to organize and prioritize many linked issues (bugs, enhancements, tasks, etc) from a Features. For example, some issues may be must-fix before release and others may not.. but we have to push in on each one to check it.
fields.summary: Quick way to launch issue navigator for linked issues

fields.description:
In the previous Jira Version (e.g. 8.13) the inner Text (HTML inner Text) didn't have space after the title.

Example: "SummaryRequired" changed to "Summary Required".

This was the title for the Summary field name.

Now, this has been changed.

If we look at the HTML of the page, we will see that the Summary field has a blank space in the end.

You can see in the attached screenshots how it appears on pages.

The customer inform us that his automated testers rely on the title of field names.

We would like to have a way of customizing these Inner texts since it can lead to problems with automation and other name-reliant systems.
fields.summary: Ability to change HTML Inner Text for Fields

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Random version of user returned if a user exists in more than 1 directory.

+How to replicate+
 # Create a new User Directory in Jira
 # Populate the directory with the same username/ same display name from the default Jira Internal Directory add a different email to easy distinguish.
 # Assignee, and mention suggestions show random version of the user

h3. Environment

JIRA 8.19.1+
h3. Expected Results

Ideally only top directory version of the user should appear but because  JRASERVER-68456 exists users should have at least possibility to select the preferred user version.
h3. Actual Results

Users with identical username who exist in different directories will randomly show up in suggestion list, at different attempts to search for a user(or for different queries matching the same user). Depending on the context, the user might see duplicate with the correct version of the user, appearing in "Suggestion" section of the list
h3. Workaround

Avoid using duplicate username or manually deactivate the user duplicates in the database (set active=0) (DB: cwd_user.active)
fields.summary: Random version of user returned if a user exists in more than 1 directory.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

This issue comes from JFR data from JAC.
Every time we change group membership, nodes in the cluster recalculate the current user count to check against the license. This process is asynchronous and deduplicated, but I believe it needs to be further improved.
For JAC, I've seen it triggered 375 time in a timespan of 4 hours, with each call taking ~20s (that's a 2h total).
It has been a problem in the past and is currently invisible in our synthetic testing.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up a breakpoint in com.atlassian.jira.application.DefaultApplicationRoleManager#clearUserCounts
 # add a user to the system

h3. Expected Results
# the method will not execute the recalc right away
# the method will not be called on all the nodes

h3. Actual Results
# the recalc is initiated right away
# each node recalculates data individually

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Altering group membership has performance impact on large instances
Menu bar items are displayed with a blue border when clicked, which can be discordant with the defined Look and Feel

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a user submits the form from an issue collector, it may fail on the following scenario:
 * The [issue collector|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver0813/using-the-issue-collector-1027138039.html] is configured with Attempt to match submitter email address.
 * The user from the email attribute used in the form is registered on Jira, but doesn't have any [application access|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/manage-group-access-to-applications-938847042.html].

Submitting the form fails with an error on the Jira backend saying the matched user doesn't have an application access.

On the UI to create an issue collector there's a mandatory field to choose a _default reporter_ with the following information:
{quote}
Reporter for the issue. Used unless a reporter is matched to a Jira user with create issue permissions.
{quote}

Although existing on Jira, the user doesn't have application access, hence not having _create issue_ permission.
Therefore, the issue collector should use the _default reporter_ instead of throwing an error.

This might be an issue for those customers synchronizing users from an external LDAP, even those that shouldn't have access to Jira.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install a vanilla instance of Jira.
  #* This was validated on Jira Software 8.13.10 and 8.20.1.
 # Create a new user without any application access.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 # Create a new _Scrum_ project with sample data.
 # Add an issue collector to that project
  #* On _Match reporter_ choose _Attempt to match submitter email address_.
 # Create a sample HTML so you can add the issue collector to it.
 # Access the sample HTML from a browser and click on _Provide feedback_.
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
 # Fill in the issue collector form and use the email of the sample user created on a previous step.
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 
 # Click on *Submit*.

h3. Expected Results
The form is submitted without any error and an issue is created on Jira using the default reporter.

h3. Actual Results
Submitting the form fails with the following error on the UI:
{code}
Oops! Something went wrong...
There was a problem submitting your feedback, likely due to the configuration of this form. You might want to contact the site owner to let them know about this issue.
{code}
 !screenshot-4.png|thumbnail! 

The following error is added to the application log:
{code}
2021-11-19 17:19:46,599-0300 http-nio-48201-exec-2 ERROR user001 1039x424x1 kptx6c 127.0.0.1 /rest/collectors/1.0/template/form/bae3f051 [c.a.j.c.plugin.rest.TemplateResource] Detected errors in collector 'Test issue collector' (id: bae3f051, project SCRUM): [Sorry, you can't create any issues right now, as you need to have access to a Jira application to be able to create issues. To gain application access you need to be a member of a group assigned to an application.]
{code}

h3. Workaround
_Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available._

While there's no direct workaround for this situation, an administrator may try the following:
 * Use an [LDAP filter|https://confluence.atlassian.com/kb/how-to-write-ldap-search-filters-792496933.html] to synchronize only users that should have access to Jira.
 * Give application access to affected users.
 * Configure the issue collector to _Always use issue reporter_.
fields.summary: Submitting an issue through an issue collector with attempt to match submitter email address enabled may fail if the user exists on Jira without any application access

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Portfolio plan taking time when the plan has a configuration to list any  *custom field* of type {*}label{*}. 


h3. How to Replicate
- Create a plan and configure the plan to list any custom field with a type label

h3. Observation 
- Plan mare server call for loading the page. One the call for loading the labels is "/rest/jpo/1.0/labels"
- This takes more time 10-13 sec for instance of huge size (7M issues )
- This is because Jira searches through all issues on the instance to which projects the current user has access to

h3. Suggestion 
- It would be great, if we search only for the issues on the project where the plan is configured
fields.summary: Portfolio plan load performance is impacted when a custom filed of type label  is used in configuration.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Uploading attachment on "Create Issue" form results with an error "There is 1 error in this form".
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new issue using "Create" button
 # Add new attachment either:
#* Using the attachment button (Description field) or
#* Using the browse button / drag and drop in the Attachments field

h3. Expected Results

The attachment is added without issues.
h3. Actual Results

The attachment is added, but the following error appears on the top of the form:
!image-2021-11-18-11-56-41-360.png|thumbnail!



(i) You will still be able to create the ticket and the attachment will be added as well, despite the error being shown on the creation form:

!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Uploading attachment on "Create Issue" form results with an error "There is 1 error in this form"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If we set status property "*jira.permission.comment.user*" with value "*false*" for "*DONE*" status then it is not working properly as expected. Tested with Software simplified workflow and is reproducible on 8.20.0, 8.20.1 and 8.17.1 versions.
 - The "*Add Comment*" button still appears on moving the issue to "*DONE*" (ideally expected to disappear).
 - The "*Add Comment*" button is duplicated on moving the issue from "*DONE*" to other statuses (say re-open, TO DO etc).

After page reloaded work correctly some time and the problem appears again later if similar actions are performed.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set property "*jira.permission.comment.user*" with value "*false*" for "*DONE*" status using "*Software Simplified Workflow*" as per the knowledge Base article: [How to deactivate comments for closed issues|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-deactivate-comments-for-closed-issues-648217599.html]
 # Create new issue.
 # Transition issue to *DONE* status (Add Comment should disappear, not happening).
 # Transition issue to *TO DO* status (Add Comment should be present, but getting duplicated).

h3. Expected Results
- On transitioning issue to *DONE* status "*Add Comment*" should disappear.
- On transitioning issue to *TO DO* status one entry for "*Add Comment*" should be present.

h3. Actual Results
- On transitioning issue to *DONE* status "*Add Comment*" still appears on the screen, not refreshed.
- On transitioning issue to *TO DO* status 2 entries of "*Add Comment*" are present (duplication).
- Trying to add the comment on an issue in *DONE* status still doesn't work and throws error "*Communications Breakdown*" and needs a page refresh to work as expected.

h3. Workaround

Page should be reloaded to get this addressed. 
 However, this is observed to happen repeatedly for new issues and for same issues if accessed at a later point of time and similar transitions are made. So refresh is the only option at the moment.
fields.summary: Setting Workflow Status property "jira.permission.comment.user" with value "false" is not working properly as expected

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Writing the Word "Jira" in the Comment of an issue prevents the user from hitting space to enter whitespace. This only happens in Safari.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open an issue 
 # Hit the "Add a comment" button 
 # Start typing the comment, until type *Jira*

h3. Expected Results
After typing Jira, hit the space and keep typing 
h3. Actual Results
After typing Jira, when the space key gets hit, nothing happens.  

h3. Workaround
# Type "Jir" and then keep writing, when it's finished add the "a" from Jira
# Type all the messages but the word "Jira", when it's finished, write "Jira" in the correct part.
fields.summary: Commenting on an Issue on Safari using the Word Jira prevents from continuing to write

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Server Error while assigning Issue or performing mentioned Search in comment
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure Jira 8.20.1 instance connected to mssql
 # Enable nested groups for the local Jira directory
 # Create a hierarchy of nested groups that were members of each other like the following:
 ## Nested16 -> nested15 -> nested14 and so forth
 # Added several users as members to nested group 16.
 # Configured project permissions to only allow assignable users from group nested1.
 # Attempt to assign user or perform mention search in comment

h3. Expected Results

User should be able to Assign user and also perform @mention search in Comment.
h3. Actual Results

Assigning and performing mention search in comment fails with below error

Error faced by user

!image-2021-11-17-16-46-28-480.png|width=300,height=103!

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
Caused by: com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerException: The incoming request has too many parameters. The server supports a maximum of 2100 parameters. Reduce the number of parameters and resend the request. {noformat}
h3. Workaround 
 * Modify project permissions if it's just a few projects
 * Disable nested groups entirely if it's happening all over the place

h3. Additional Information 

With the above environment in place we can see the following query is executed whenever the search occurs:
{code:java}
(@P0 nvarchar(4000),@P1 nvarchar(4000),@P2 nvarchar(4000),@P3 nvarchar(4000),@P4 nvarchar(4000),@P5 nvarchar(4000),@P6 nvarchar(4000),@P7 nvarchar(4000),@P8 nvarchar(4000),@P9 nvarchar(4000),@P10 nvarchar(4000),@P11 nvarchar(4000),@P12 nvarchar(4000),@P13 nvarchar(4000),@P14 nvarchar(4000),@P15 nvarchar(4000),@P16 nvarchar(4000),@P17 bigint,@P18 int,@P19 int,@P20 bigint)select CWD_USER.id, CWD_USER.directory_id, CWD_USER.user_name, CWD_USER.lower_user_name, CWD_USER.active, CWD_USER.created_date, CWD_USER.updated_date, CWD_USER.first_name, CWD_USER.lower_first_name, CWD_USER.last_name, CWD_USER.lower_last_name, CWD_USER.display_name, CWD_USER.lower_display_name, CWD_USER.email_address, CWD_USER.lower_email_address, CWD_USER.credential, CWD_USER.deleted_externally, CWD_USER.external_id
from dbo.cwd_user CWD_USER
where (CWD_USER.lower_user_name in (select MEMBERSHIP.lower_child_name
from dbo.cwd_membership MEMBERSHIP
where MEMBERSHIP.membership_type = @P0 and (MEMBERSHIP.lower_parent_name in (@P1, @P2, @P3, @P4, @P5, @P6, @P7, @P8, @P9, @P10, @P11, @P12, @P13, @P14, @P15, @P16)))) and CWD_USER.directory_id = @P17 and CWD_USER.active = @P18
order by CWD_USER.lower_display_name asc
offset @P19 rows fetch next @P20 rows only
{code}
The following portion of the *where* clause keeps expanding in number of parameters as the nested tree grows:
{code:java}
and (MEMBERSHIP.lower_parent_name in (@P1, @P2, @P3, @P4, @P5, @P6, @P7, @P8, @P9, @P10, @P11, @P12, @P13, @P14, @P15, @P16)
{code}
Here we've added in *nested17* into the hierarchy:
{code:java}
and (MEMBERSHIP.lower_parent_name in (@P1, @P2, @P3, @P4, @P5, @P6, @P7, @P8, @P9, @P10, @P11, @P12, @P13, @P14, @P15, @P16, @P17)
{code}
And now we have 22 in the hierarchy:
{code:java}
and (MEMBERSHIP.lower_parent_name in (@P1, @P2, @P3, @P4, @P5, @P6, @P7, @P8, @P9, @P10, @P11, @P12, @P13, @P14, @P15, @P16, @P17, @P18, @P19, @P20, @P21, @P22)
{code}
We can continue to grow this list of parameters by adding new groups into the hierarchy until we hit:
{code:java}
Caused by: com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerException: The incoming request has too many parameters. The server supports a maximum of 2100 parameters. Reduce the number of parameters and resend the request.
{code}
Looks like we made a lot of changes to how the lookup occurs as a part of https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-72101, which may have introduced this regression in cases of deep nested group relationships.
fields.summary: Server Error while assigning Issue or performing mentioned Search in comment

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Overlap of fixed versions in issue while editing
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add 15 Project Versions
 # Attempt to create an issue and then edit the same by adding multiple fix versions approx 10.
 # Re-edit the fix version field in the newly created Issue

h3. Expected Results

All the fix versions added should clearly visible
h3. Actual Results

Previously added fix versions gets overlapped
!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

It displays correctly when you focus the field, e.g. clicking anywhere within the field or on the expand icon on the drop down.

!image-2021-11-17-16-26-44-113.png|width=294,height=58!
fields.summary: Overlap of fixed versions in issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Maximum timeout of Favorite Filters gadget is not respected. If setting it as 1000(1 second), JQL query still keep running longer than it, without timeout.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setting Maximum timeout of Favorite Filters gadget to 1000 ms(1 second)
 # Running a slow JQL query (longer than 1 second)

h3. Expected Results

The query will be timeout.
h3. Actual Results

It keep running more than 1 second.

Logs in atlassian-jira-slow-queries.log shows it took '2116' ms to run.
{noformat}
2021-10-22 17:33:29,239+0900 http-nio-8080-exec-11 INFO admin  /rest/gadget/1.0/favfilters/count [c.a.j.i.search.providers.LuceneSearchProvider_SLOW] ScriptRunner JQL function 'dateCompare' with clause '{issueFunction in dateCompare(, created <= updated)}' took '2116' ms to run
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Maximum timeout of Favorite Filters gadget is not respected

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In Jira Data Center, when a project is archived, the workflow scheme list will indicate a project using that workflow is archived with the following formatting {{<projectname>(archived)}}. When viewing similar lists for Issue Type Schemes and Issue Type Screen Schemes, the archived projects using those schemes are listed, but not marked as archived.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Archive a project.
 # View in Issue Type Scheme list or Issue Type Screen Scheme list.

h3. Suggested Solution
For the archived projects to be marked as archived in all of the following views: Workflow Schemes, Issue Type Screen Schemes, and Issue Type Schemes.
fields.summary: Mark projects as archived in Issue Type Scheme and Issue Type Screen Scheme listings

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

At the moment, when we create a scrum project, and all the issues in the backlog display their story points but not the sum or an estimative of the total, like when we create a sprint. 
The idea is to make it possible to see the estimative of the issue's story points in the backlog before sending them to the sprint.
fields.summary: Make Possible to see the Sum or Estimative of Issues Story Points also in the Backlog

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In the *searchrequest-xml-header.vm* file under '<Jira_Install>atlassian-jira\WEB-INF\classes\templates\plugins\searchrequestviews' folder if  the line *<?xml-stylesheet href="${requestContext.baseUrl}/styles/jiraxml2html.xsl" type="text/xsl"?>* is uncommented the export fails with either a blank page or hits an error "Error loading stylesheet: An unknown error has occurred (805303f4)"
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install and setup Jira 8.19.0 with internal database
# AFter successful setup, stop Jira
# Uncomment the line *<?xml-stylesheet href="${requestContext.baseUrl}/styles/jiraxml2html.xsl" type="text/xsl"?>* from *searchrequest-xml-header.vm* file under '<Jira_Install>atlassian-jira\WEB-INF\classes\templates\plugins\searchrequestviews' folder
# Start the Jira
# On the search issues page try to export via the XML option

h3. Expected Results
Load the page with the expected style sheet
h3. Actual Results
Error loading stylesheet: An unknown error has occurred (805303f4)
OR
A blank page

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: XML Export of issues via jiraxml2html.xsl no longer works

fields.description: Sometimes blocks/blocked by doesn't really fit and to be able to use Precede/Succeed (or follows/followed by) for instance would be really useful in instances where a ticket can use the output from another but doesn't necessarily have to.
fields.summary: Linked Issue Relationship - Precede and Succeed

fields.description:
h3. Issue

When exporting issues from the issue search page, the option *Export > CSV (current fields)* does not respect the columns selected in *Columns > Filter*. Instead, it uses the columns selected in *Columns > Filter*.

h3. Steps to replicate

# Go to the issue search page and enter a search query
# Configure the setting *Columns > My Default* to only show 2 columns (For example: *Assignee* and *Created*)
 !Issue_Replicated1.png|thumbnail! 
# Switch the column configuration from *Columns > My Default* to *Columns > Filter*, and add a few extra columns such as *Sprint*, *Component* and *Summary*
 !Issue_Replicated2.png|thumbnail! 
# Export the search results using the option *Export > CSV (current fields)*
# Open the CSV file

h3. Expected behavior

The CSV file should contain the 5 columns selected in *Columns > Filter* (Assignee, Created, Sprint, Component and Summary).

h3. Actual behavior

The CSV file only contains the 2 columns selected in  *Columns > My Default* (Assignee, Created)
 !Issue_Replicated3.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Before exporting issues as a CSV file, select the columns you want to export in *Columns > My Default* instead of *Columns > Filter*
fields.summary: CSV Export using current fields does not follow the visible column configuration
Update Advanced Cleanup documentation

fields.description:
It would be useful to include the following Bulk related information in the [Creating issues and comments from email|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/creating-issues-and-comments-from-email-938847641.html] article:

1) What is the precedence between the *Bulk settings* from the Mail Handler setup and the {*}Advanced mail loop detection{*}.

*!image-2021-11-15-14-47-50-130.png|width=504,height=260!*

*!image-2021-11-15-14-49-01-236.png|width=721,height=180!*

As far as it seems, the bulk settings from the Mail Handler setup will take precedence over the mail loop ones. Loop detection is verified only for the messages that pass the bulk check. Mail loop detection is the last check, everything else must be ok first.

2) What is the correct *syntax* in the *Whitelisted domains* configuration.

As far as it seems, the values specified the Whitelisted domains must have no quotes and be separated by comma. Also, leading and trailing spaces are ignored.
fields.summary: Update Mail Handler Documentation related to Bulk settings

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Adding gadgets require a live URL with the file name in XML format.
If the file is no longer available in the provided URL, the gadget fails to load.
The Add a Gadget process could allow other endpoint types to serve files via APIs or Scriptrunner or Jira could store the uploaded xml locally.
!screenshot-1.png|width=628,height=240! 
 

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the Manage Gadget page
 # Provide the URL of the xml file from a temporary web server
 # Add the gadget
!image-2021-11-12-16-40-29-314.png!

h3. Expected Results

Gadget is added and loaded on the Dashboard

!image-2021-11-12-16-38-17-286.png!

!image-2021-11-12-16-39-33-503.png!
h3. Actual Results

If the URL of the source file is no longer available, the gadget fails to load
!image-2021-11-12-16-41-01-891.png!
h3. Workaround

1) Install Python in a server and start the *SimpleHTTPServer* webserver to host the xml files
2) Store the files in an AWS Bucket or Azure Blob
fields.summary: Allow other types of endpoints to add xml gadgets in Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If a custom field has multiple contexts and issues from different projects in more than one context are selected in bulk edit, the custom field won't show up even if doesn't have a different set of options in each context (text field, labels, etc...) 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field with type labels.
# Create two contexts with a different set of projects. 
# Run a bulk edit on issues from two projects that are present in different contexts. 
# Make sure the custom field is present in the edit screens of the two projects and issue types being edited. 

h3. Expected Results
The custom field should be present in the bulk edit screen. 

h3. Actual Results
Custom field is not present. However, if the issues selected to be edited are from projects within the same custom field context, the field will shop up. 
h3. Workaround
Edit the issues from projects within the same context together.
fields.summary: Custom field doesn't show in bulk edit if it has multiple contexts

fields.description:
Switching priority schemes is unintuitive, confusing and *potentially disastrous*.

It should be possible to simply switch the scheme for the current project, like changing other shared schemes or workflows.    

The current process where you can alter a large number of projects and lose previous configurations with one click i.e. click rather than a ctrl-click on the list of projects using a priority scheme will remove all other projects from the scheme.   It isn't that obvious what is happening from then on, especially as it breaks with the normal way of switching project configuration.
fields.summary: Switching priority schemes is crazy and potentially disastrous.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As a Jira user, it would be nice to be able to specify default values for multiple issue types for the description field on a project. By doing this, the control of the issue types can be more specified and avoid possible mistakes during the process of a ticket. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to System Fields 
 # Choose the desired field
 # Select the default value, issue type, and the project.

h3. Expected Results

For each issue type, it'll be able to select the project and set the default value (i.e Story, Bug, etc.)
h3. Actual Results

There's no way to do this function because Jira does not have the option to add default values within issue types in a single project directly by the system fields. 
h3. Workaround

It's possible to use different workflows for each issue type and add a post function _update field_ on a transition. For custom fields, it might need _JSU_ as it allows a post function called {_}update any field{_}. Another way is to use _Automation for Jira_ and trigger an automation rule on create or transition. With _Automation for Jira,_ it's possible to use a single workflow and create if/then/else branches. Both _JSU_ and _Automation for Jira_ are plugins in the marketplace.
fields.summary: Specify default values for multiple issue types for the description field on a project

fields.description:
Some users need to have external links in Description / Comments to open in new browser window.
Looks like this should be per-user configurable.

*Workaround*
Use the middle-click on your mouse if you have a three-button mouse, ctrl-click on Windows/Unix, or cmd-click on Mac.
fields.summary: external links to open in new window

fields.description:
With the current design in place for the Audit logging,  we have the least amount of logging for User Management (base level), and also the option to disable this specific logging altogether.

We need more fine-grained control of this (e.g. via auditing properties) as disabling it all together won't be a suitable option.

For example, customer noticed as about 98% of their audit logs were coming from the "User management" and is caused by the {*}Active Directory sync{*}. They had it set to "Base" level." The health check was throwing a "Audit log Capacity" error and running the query showed they had 10 million records in the table.
fields.summary: Audit log: Provide the ability for a more fine-grained control of "User Management" events

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Agile Wallboard Gadget is displaying a message whenever the board being used in the filter is empty.

The message points to a gadget configuration issue, even though it works properly if any issue is present on the board.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add the Agile Wallboard Gadget to a Dashboard.
 # If the board is empty, the message is displayed.
!8.20message.png!
 # If the board has issues on it, the same gadget displays as expected.
!8.20.png!

h3. Expected Results

With the same configuration in Jira 8.4.x the gadget doesn't display the warning message.
!8.4.png!
h3. Actual Results

The message below is displayed, although the issue doesn't seem related.
{quote}There are problems with the current configuration for this gadget. The errors below may have been caused by the deletion of entities required by the gadget or by changes to your permissions.
{quote}
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Agile Wallboard Gadget is wrongly displaying a message for an empty board.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira does not disable the Create button while creating issues.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Setup Jira 8.20.0 / 8.20.1 
 * Using the Create button try to Create a new issue under any Project, you will notice that the Create button is not greyed out at the bottom which allows the user to click the Create button twice:
!image-2021-11-10-19-47-45-485.png|width=468,height=400!

 * When the Create Button is clicked twice, a dialog box is opened stating 'XSRF Security Token Missing':
!image-2021-11-10-19-47-56-687.png|width=469,height=401!

 * Click on Retry Operation, you will notice that 'There are 2 errors in this form' error:
!image-2021-11-10-19-48-17-404.png|width=467,height=399!

 * If you click on Create button again, you will notice that there are two issues are created with the same title:
!image-2021-11-10-19-49-39-223.png!

*On Jira 8.13 versions:*
When we try to Create issue we notice that the Create button is greyed out which does not allow duplicate issues to be created:

!image-2021-11-10-19-49-01-995.png|width=497,height=541!
h3. Expected Results

Create button should be greyed out after clicking the Create button once.
h3. Actual Results

Create button is not greyed out after clicking the Create button once.
h3. Workaround

After Clicking on Retry Operation, If you Cancel and Click OK:
!image-2021-11-10-19-48-39-740.png|width=485,height=414!

Only one issue will get created as Expected:
!image-2021-11-10-19-49-53-416.png!

Recording for 8.20: [^8.20.0_reprobug.mov]

Recording for 8.13: [^8.13.4_repro.mov]
fields.summary: Jira does not disable the Create button while creating issues.

fields.description:

OutOfMemoryErrors when starting the Jira instance.

ThreadPoolAsyncTaskExecutor::Thread 13 consumes a Retained Heap of 6,422,859,280.

The java.io.UnixFileSystem holds 30,830,856 entries of java.lang.String values from uk.org.simonsite.log4j.appender called by the com.atlassian.analytics.client.logger.Log4jAnalyticsLogger
h3. Environment

Jira 8.13.4
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Unknown
h3. Expected Results

Analytics plugin memory consumption does not grow to disproportionate amounts.
h3. Actual Results

Analytics plugin consumes >6GB of retained heap space.
h3. Workaround

Negated condition within the workflow caused the passesCondition() method to always return false

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the user has a special character as part of the username, the admin cannot verify permissions for him on the permission helper
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a user using a username with a special character 
 # Open the permission helper
 # Select an issue and permission
 # On the user tab, choose the created user.

h3. Expected Results

Find the user and execute the permission helper.
h3. Actual Results

By the time the submit button gets clicked, it shots an error <User 'username' is unknown>
h3. Workaround

Removing the special character from the username and the full name, then the permission helper will work properly.
fields.summary: Permission Helper Cannot Handle Username with Special Character (+)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When users have access to project A link an issue to project B where they have no permissions they can search for and link the issues however it is not displayed on screen. 
h3. Steps to reproduce
 * Give user Permission to Project A but no Permission to Project B
 * Create issues in both projects (using an admin account or an account with permissions to both projects)
 * Open issue in Project A and add link to issue in project B.
 * Link shows as a success
 * No link is shown in issue links area
 * History and activity shows the link occurred

h3. Expected results

Issue links should be visible but not accessible
h3. Actual results

Issue links are hidden
h3. Workaround

n/a
h3. Why this is important

User with no access to Project B should be able to see the link in the link section (but still not be able to open issue in project B). The feedback allows users to be able to identify when they have successfully linked an issue. With the current behavior, users can link issues, but can't see the issue they just linked - which can lead to users inadvertently linking issues multiple times.
fields.summary: Users should be able to see issue links to projects they don't have permissions to

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Incorrect German translation when adding attachments to an issue.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1

While adding attachments to an issue there is a translation error for the German language. The following message is shown:

"Dateien ablegen, um sie an den Vorhang anzuhängen"

Correct would be:

"Dateien ablegen, um sie an den Vorgang anzuhängen"

Issues are translated to "Vorhang" here, which means curtain in german :)
The correct translation would be "Vorgang".
h3. Expected Results

Dateien ablegen, um sie an den Vorgang anzuhängen as correct messge
h3. Actual Results

Dateien ablegen, um sie an den Vorhang anzuhängen as a message
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Incorrect German translation when adding attachments to an issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
By enabling the [Profiling logs|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/logging-and-profiling-938847671.html#Loggingandprofiling-profilingProfiling] in Jira, along with the expected profiling information, several Warning messages are added to the atlassian-jira.log, informing that _*{{ThreadLocalQueryProfiler#store was called outside of the context}}*_.

While this does not seem to have any negative performance effects on the instance, it can make the investigation of performance problems more difficult due to the amount of WARN messages added to the logs

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to *Jira administration (gear icon) > System > Logging and Profiling*
 # Enable the [Profiling logs|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/logging-and-profiling-938847671.html#Loggingandprofiling-profilingProfiling].
# Access any issues that contain an attachment.
(i) This is just one example of how to trigger the issue. Other identified triggers are
#* Create a project using sample data.
#* Create an Object Schema on Insight.
#* The execution of an Insight Automation rule.
#* A POST to the /rest/analytics/1.0/publish/bulk endpoint.

h3. Expected Results
Only profiling information should be added to the logs.

h3. Actual Results
Along with the profiling data, several warnings related to Incorrect JIRA API usage can be added to the Jira logs depending on the actions taken.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary



JQL does not return correct issues when custom priorities have numeric values
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create some priorities in Jira like 1, 2, add them to the project
 # Create issue with priority 1 and 2
 # Search issues using JQL (priority = 1 or priority = 2)

h3. Expected Results

Issues with priority 1 and 2 should be visible in the results
h3. Actual Results

Issues with priority 1 and 2 are not visible in the results
h3. Workaround
 * Either use priority names without numeric values
 * Or, use the Priority ID in the JQL
fields.summary: JQL does not return correct issues when custom priorities have numeric values

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira webhooks suddenly stop working, after an error happens in the [httpcore|https://hc.apache.org/httpcomponents-core-4.4.x/index.html] component in the {{org.apache.httpcomponents}} library.

The error is documented in the bug [https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HTTPCORE-695]:
{noformat}
2021-10-12 00:22:19,326-0400 httpclient-io:thread-1 ERROR anonymous     [o.a.h.i.nio.client.InternalHttpAsyncClient] I/O reactor terminated abnormally
org.apache.http.nio.reactor.IOReactorException: I/O dispatch worker terminated abnormally
	at org.apache.http.impl.nio.reactor.AbstractMultiworkerIOReactor.execute(AbstractMultiworkerIOReactor.java:356)
	at org.apache.http.impl.nio.conn.PoolingNHttpClientConnectionManager.execute(PoolingNHttpClientConnectionManager.java:221)
	at org.apache.http.impl.nio.client.CloseableHttpAsyncClientBase$1.run(CloseableHttpAsyncClientBase.java:64)
	at java.base/java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:834)
Caused by: java.nio.channels.CancelledKeyException
	at java.base/sun.nio.ch.SelectionKeyImpl.ensureValid(SelectionKeyImpl.java:71)
	at java.base/sun.nio.ch.SelectionKeyImpl.interestOps(SelectionKeyImpl.java:96)
	at org.apache.http.impl.nio.reactor.AbstractIOReactor.processPendingInterestOps(AbstractIOReactor.java:459)
	at org.apache.http.impl.nio.reactor.AbstractIOReactor.execute(AbstractIOReactor.java:298)
	at org.apache.http.impl.nio.reactor.BaseIOReactor.execute(BaseIOReactor.java:104)
	at org.apache.http.impl.nio.reactor.AbstractMultiworkerIOReactor$Worker.run(AbstractMultiworkerIOReactor.java:588)
{noformat}
When it happens, the *{{I/O dispatcher #}}* threads with # from 1-10 are ended, and as a consequence the webhooks stop working.
 This broken state can be verified by inspecting thread dumps or running the command below:
{code:java}
JIRA_PID=`ps aux | grep -i jira | grep -i [j]ava | awk  -F '[ ]*' '{print $2}'`;
jstack -l $JIRA_PID |grep "I/O dispatcher"
{code}
There are no errors in the logs, but we simply can't find the {{I/O dispatcher}} thread logs as shown [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-fails-to-post-webhooks-to-external-system-due-to-network-infrastructure-blocking-the-request-954254917.html] with the appropriate debug settings.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Can't reproduce.
h3. Expected Results

Webhooks work normally.
h3. Actual Results

Apparently at random, the webhooks stop working.
h3. Workaround

Restart the affected nodes.
fields.summary: Jira webhooks stop working after "I/O reactor terminated abnormally" error

fields.description:
Issue Summary
Pasting screen shot images from clip board into issue descriptions or comments in 'Visual' mode throws error. The issue is only on Chrome and on Linux OS. It works well in all browsers in other operating systems except Linux. It works in Text mode on Linux in all browsers. It works well in both Text and Visual in Firefox on Linux but not on Chrome. 

Jira version: 8.20.1
Browsers: Chrome Version v95.0.4638.54 on Linux 

Steps to Reproduce
* Open any issue, click the 'description' field and ensure 'Visual' is selected
* Run 'gnome-screenshot', 'Select area to grab', take a screenshot of an area, and 'Copy to Clipboard'
* Paste into the description field.

Expected Results
Screen Capture is pasted in the issue description or comment

Actual Results
Image not pasted and Console logs error:

{code}
plugin.js:9 Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'type' of null
    at plugin.js:9
    at plugin.js:9
    at he (plugin.js:9)
    at JE.<anonymous> (plugin.js:9)
    at bE.fire (tinymce.js?batch=false:9)
    at JE.fire (tinymce.js?batch=false:9)
    at EE (tinymce.js?batch=false:9)
    at Object.e (tinymce.js?batch=false:9)
    at Oi.executeHandlers (tinymce.js?batch=false:9)
    at HTMLBodyElement.d (tinymce.js?batch=false:9)
{code}

Workaround
User Text mode or use other browsers.
fields.summary: Error on Paste Screen Capture in Visual Mode

fields.description:
Cloudflare Rocket Loader is an optional feature of the Cloudflare CDN which allows for JS minification, and asynchronous JS loading, which allows for HTML and CSS to be loaded without waiting on JS to load.

Some pages in Jira, notably the audit log page, load as blank pages when using Rocket Loader. As Rocket Loader can increase the speed of page loads, it would be an advantage to be able to use Rocket Loader without compatibility issues with the way our resources are loaded and rendered.
fields.summary: Add compatibility for Cloudflare Rocket Loader

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
Azure has launched a new database service, called Azure Database for MySQL - Flexible Server, described here: 
* https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/mysql/flexible-server/overview

Jira currently does not have official support for it yet. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add official support for Azure Database for MySQL - Flexible Server
fields.summary: Support for Azure Database for MySQL Flexible Server

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Update check on Jira says essential plugins like Advanced Roadmaps are incompatible. Starting from Jira 8.15 [Advanced Roadmaps is now part of Jira Software Data Center|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/jira-software-8-15-x-release-notes-1041828739.html#JiraSoftware8.15.xreleasenotes-ar], so it's bundled and not available as a separate Add-on.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a Jira instance (version 8.14.0 or lower) installed along with the "Advanced Roadmaps for Jira" (version 3.29.8 or lower) app.
 #  Access the [App compatibility checker|https://confluence.atlassian.com/upm/checking-app-compatibility-with-application-updates-273875705.html] tool.
(i) To access this page we can follow two different paths.
 ** Either go to {*}Jira administration (gear icon) > Manage Apps > Find new apps{*}, and click on the *JIRA update check* link at the bottom of the page.
 ** Or go {*}Jira administration (gear icon) > Applications > Plan your upgrade{*}, expand {*}Step 3{*}, and click on the *JIRA update check* link.
 # Once we're on the app compatibility page, for the *Check compatibility for update to* select {*}8.15.0 or higher{*}.
 # Click on *Check*

h3. Expected Results

Update check reports proper compatibility data.
h3. Actual Results

Update check is false positive.
!FalsePositive.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Disable the plugins marked as incompatible and upgrade Jira. After the upgrade, check to ensure the new bundled versions are enabled.
fields.summary: Preupgrade Jira check marks some Jira plugin incompatible with 8.15.x or higher

fields.description:
It would be great if we can use Plan your upgrade in an offline environment. Like generate a JSON/XML with the current version and settings of Jira+ plugins.

Recommend versions to use, including links to the latest version of plugins. But also inform administrators about turned off plugins which breaks upgrading the application. Or settings which can be optimized.
fields.summary: As a Jira admin I would like to have an upgrade plan feature

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When inserting Bidirectional Unicode characters (e.g. {{U+202A}}) into RTE from virtual keyboard they are not escaped properly.

They are escaped when the text containing such characters is pasted. After saving the edited text it is rendered correctly regardless of how the text was inserted.

*This does not affect 8.20.1.*
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Ensure the RTE is enabled in Jira.
 # Open Create Issue view.
 # Add {{code}} or {{preformatted}} panel into description.
 # Open your virtual input method (i.e. ctrl-cmd-space on Mac, on other OSes it may differ).
 # Insert some BiDi characters into the created panel.

h3. Expected Results

The characters are escaped properly.

!image-2021-11-04-08-53-28-017.png!
h3. Actual Results

The characters are not escaped.

!image-2021-11-04-08-54-12-264.png!

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unicode BiDi Characters inserted with virtual keyboard are not escaped

h3. Workaround

This behaviour appears when Jira is (for whatever reason) missing some data in the "cwd_user" table. We can check the "cwd_user" table with the following SQL query:
{code:sql}
SELECT * FROM cwd_user WHERE (
first_name IS NULL OR
lower_first_name IS NULL OR
last_name IS NULL OR
lower_last_name IS NULL OR
display_name IS NULL OR
lower_display_name IS NULL);
{code}
To recreate the missing data, find the usernames listed by the SQL query on the *User management -> Users* page. Click the "Edit" link associated with the affected user and then the "Update" button without making any changes. fields.description:
From [Jira Cloud documentation|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/configure-advanced-issue-workflows/] we can see that there are few workflow optional conditions that could be useful in the Jira Server side as well, such as User Is In Custom Field:

 
|Condition|Description|
|User Is In Custom Field|Allows only users in a given custom field to execute the transition.|

 

By adding this as a built-in Jira option many customers could benefit from having this condition as a native option.
fields.summary: Add the workflow condition "User Is In Custom Field" in Jira Server

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When adding lines for custom filters in the jira-config.properties the value for the issue filter takes the value of the history filter.

For example after adding these two lines both will display the same number of items:

{code}
jira.max.issue.filter.dropdown.items = 4
jira.max.issue.history.dropdown.items = 5
{code}

 !image-2021-11-03-16-53-31-723.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment

Jira server 8.13.12

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Shutdown your JIRA application
# Go to the JIRA applications Home Directory
# Add the below lines to the jira-config.properties, changing the numeral to the number of issues/filters you'd like to be displayed;
{code}
jira.max.issue.filter.dropdown.items = 4
jira.max.issue.history.dropdown.items = 5
{code}
# Save the file
# Start the application
# Click on issue dropdown.

h3. Expected Results

The number of items displayed should match the filter settings in the jira-config.properties

h3. Actual Results

The values from the first filter are applied to the second filter value.

h3. Workaround

Currently no workaround.
fields.summary: Filter settings values in jira-config.properties do not work as expected.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When users create custom fields offered by Jira Toolkit plugin (From Atlassian Labs) and add them as part of different screens including "create, view, edit" issue scenarios. these fields are not visible at all. 

If we validate presence of these fields using "*where is my field*", then the results display all green mentioning that these fields should be part of specific project, screen, form you are viewing but the fields are not present.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Jira Version 8.20.0
# Install Jira Toolkit plugin version 0.37.0.
# Create one test software project for validation of the problem in context.
# Create some customfield of type "Original Estimate" and configure it to be part of all screens associated with the project (mainly create, edit issue screens).
# Try to create some issues in the project and look for the customfield added recently, you will not be able to find it.
# Now try to validate using "*where is my field*" check, this will show that all checks passed and field should be part of the project, screen, form you are viewing. But field is not present.
# Attached to the ticket are useful screenshots for reference.

h3. Expected Results
The customfield created using the plugin should be part of the configured forms/screens.

h3. Actual Results
The customfield created using Jira toolkit plugin are not available for any actions. Current validation is for customfields of type "*original estimate*".

If time tracking feature is enabled for the project, by default this adds a field called "*original estimate*" and this results in real confusion for the end users.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available. As this is an unsupported plugin, the priority/response may be delayed.
fields.summary: Custom fields created using Jira Toolkit plugin are not available for use while creating issue (or any screens)

fields.description:
h3. Feature request
When restoring a XML backup, Jira always performs a full lock reindex after the data has been imported. 

{code}
2021-10-21 07:04:54,189-0700 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 INFO admin 334x271x1 XXX 10.0.0.1 /secure/admin/XmlRestore.jspa [c.a.j.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService] Importing data is 96% complete...
2021-10-21 07:04:56,912-0700 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 INFO admin 334x271x1 XXX 10.0.0.1 /secure/admin/XmlRestore.jspa [c.a.j.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService] Re-indexing is 0% complete. Current index: Issue  
{code}

For larger instances, this can be a significant portion of time, and, it can be desirable to skip reindexing to
* Complete the import, a sometimes complex process, faster
* Allow flexibility on when nodes are brought up and how Jira is reindexed after import

h4. Desired solution
Add a system property to disable reindex after XML restore, akin to how reindexing can be disabled after upgrade.
fields.summary: Provide way to skip full reindex after XML restore

fields.description:
Researchers at the University of Cambridge reported a vulnerability affecting Jira Server / DC where special characters, known as Unicode bidirectional override characters, are not rendered or displayed in the affected applications. These special characters are typically not displayed by the browser or code editors but can affect the meaning of the source code when it is processed by a compiler or an interpreter. The issue is now fixed.

*Affected versions:*
 * All versions before 8.13.13

 * All versions between 8.14.0 and 8.19.1 (inclusive)

 * All 8.20.x LTS versions before 8.20.1

*Fixed versions:*
 * 8.13.13

 * 8.20.1
fields.summary: Unicode characters allow malicious code to be hidden from a human reviewer (Jira Server) - CVE-2021-42574

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A JQL search using a single sprint name may pass multiple sprint IDs in the Lucene search query. Also, it can pass IDs of the matching sprints in the Lucene query even if there isn't any sprint with the name being searched in the JQL query.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Create three scrum software Projects with the details as in the screenshot below:
 !Screenshot 2021-10-29 at 8.57.56 PM.png|thumbnail!

Now, say a user user1 makes a JQL search

sprint in ("SCRUM") 
 OR
 sprint = "SCRUM"
h3. Expected Results

JQL search shouldn't show any results as there are no issues in sprint with "SCRUM"
h3. Actual Results

!Screenshot 2021-10-29 at 9.01.26 PM.png|thumbnail!
 !Screenshot 2021-10-29 at 9.04.29 PM.png|thumbnail!
 !Screenshot 2021-10-29 at 9.27.41 PM.png|thumbnail!

JQL search also shows issues under sprints SCRUM1 and SCRUM2.

As checked in the logs JQL query

{sprint in ("SCRUM")} is converted to Lucene query (customfield_10104:22 customfield_10104:23 customfield_10104:24)
 where,
 
 22 = Sprint ID of sprint SCRUM1
 23 = Sprint ID of sprint SCRUM2
 24 = Sprint ID of sprint SCRUM
 
 
{code:java}
2021-10-29 21:01:36,803+0530 http-nio-8080-exec-14 DEBUG asdf 1261x9265x2 193q1lh 127.0.0.1 /rest/issueNav/1/issueTable [c.a.j.i.search.providers.LuceneSearchProvider] JQL query: {sprint in ("SCRUM")}{code}
{code:java}
2021-10-29 21:01:36,803+0530 http-nio-8080-exec-14 DEBUG asdf 1261x9265x2 193q1lh 127.0.0.1 /rest/issueNav/1/issueTable [c.a.j.i.search.providers.LuceneSearchProvider] JQL lucene query: (customfield_10104:22 customfield_10104:23 customfield_10104:24){code}

 converted Lucene query should be (customfield_10104:24) only
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Discrepancy in JQL search result while searching with sprint name

Currently, it is only possible to disable the watching functionality for the whole Jira instance via the setting *⚙ > System > General Configuration > Allow users to watch issues*.

This setting can not be enabled/disabled at a more granular level such as per project, or per issue type.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In Jira 7.12, the options menu for subtasks had a scrollbar. This was helpful since not all of the options could always be fitted in the displayed menu. 
However, after several version and update fixes, the scrollbar for subtask menus disappeared.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue
# Create a subtask
# Click the triple dot menu for the created subtask
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The menu would have a scroll bar, especially when there are too many items to be displayed, or if the webpage is zoomed in and it can't fit all of the contents of the menu in the screen.
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
 

h3. Actual Results
The options in the subtask menu are clipped, and are not visible.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Add the CSS below in the announcement banner as described in [KB on adding a scrollbar for subtask option menus|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+add+a+scrollbar+for+subtask+option+menus]
{code}
<style type="text/css">
div[id^="actions_"][id$="_drop"]{
    overflow: scroll;
    height: 600px;
}
</style>
{code}
This will add a scroll to any {{actions_<id>_drop}} elements in Jira when the number of elements exceed 600 pixels, which includes subtask options.
fields.summary: The scrollbar for Subtask options is gone

fields.description:
Currently, admin users are able to edit the statuses when editing a workflow. There is a suggestion ticket raised in JRASERVER-67078 to add a warning and this seems to be implemented at some points in Jira:

  !Screenshot 2021-10-27 at 10.53.53.png!

However, having this ability causes confusion when the status is used across multiple workflows that are managed by different admins, especially in the post-functions where the change goes unnoticed but the post-function fails to execute silently.

+Example provided by a customer:+

We have two environments, Prod and Test. Test is based on a recent copy of Prod. We have two administrators making changes to different projects.

Admin 1 changes Project 1. Totally unrelated to any other projects. Tests and invites the users to test. All OK-ed and we plan to move to Prod.

Admin 2 makes changes to Project 2 and renames the status from "A" to "B". This change went unnoticed.

We migrate Project 1 config to Prod. The workflow doesn't use the status "A" so didn't notice the status change. It did however use the JWT plugin. This had a series of post functions. One of the post functions looks for issues linked to the parent that are in the status "B". As this status doesn't exist in the workflow of the child issue the post function was not executed.

The workflow has numerous instances where it tested the status and as the status was wrong we had to go through every set of post functions to fix (i.e change back to "A")
fields.summary: Remove the ability to edit statuses from the workflow

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Similar to JRASERVER-71310, but this is coming from another package -- {{com.atlassian.jira.cache.request.RequestCacheRecorderImpl}}.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Jira. Issue observed in Jira 8.13.9, 8.13.10 and 8.20.0 so far.
 # Below warnings are thrown in the {{atlassian-jira.log}} file:
{noformat}
2021-10-28 10:35:09,226+1100 localhost-startStop-2 WARN      [c.a.j.cache.request.RequestCacheRecorderImpl] Invalid use of RequestCache by thread: <thread_name>.Incorrect usage of JIRA API. You can only create/use: RequestCacheImpl inside a context (request or Jira-Thread-Local). Check: JiraThreadLocalUtil for details. This message will be logged once per thread.
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Setting the log level of the {{com.atlassian.jira.cache.request.RequestCacheRecorderImpl}} package to ERROR per the documentation [Logging and profiling|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/logging-and-profiling-938847671.html]

(i) This configuration will filter out relevant warnings as well.
h4. Temporarily set the package to ERROR (this won't persist after a Jira restart)
 - In Jira, go to *⚙ > System > Logging and profiling page*
 - Scroll down to *Default Loggers > Configure logging level for another package*, and add {{com.atlassian.jira.cache.request.RequestCacheRecorderImpl}} package with the ERROR level

h4. Permanent way to set the package to ERROR (this setting will remain after a Jira restart)
 - Edit the file {{<JIRA_INSTALLATION>/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/log4j.properties}}
 - Add the 2 following lines at the end of the file and save it:
{code:java}
log4j.logger.com.atlassian.jira.cache.request.RequestCacheRecorderImpl = ERROR, filelog
log4j.additivity.com.atlassian.jira.cache.request.RequestCacheRecorderImpl = false
{code}
fields.summary: Logs of usage of RequestCache without context from the com.atlassian.jira.cache.request.RequestCacheRecorderImpl package in the logs

fields.description:
The SW package delivered by my team is composed of several SW sub-packages. These SW sub-packages are first deployed separately and then merged into the whole SW package.

The structure is as follows:
 * SW Package Major.Minor.Patch - composed of:
 ** SW 1 - Major.Minor.Patch
 ** SW 2 - Major.Minor.Patch
 ** SW 3 - Major.Minor.Patch

This grouping is standard practice in automotive sector, but in the Relases of Jira it is not possible at the moment to group together various SW Releases under one SW Package that inclused them all and has its own versioning.

My team has had to create a new field for the SW Package, but this means that we have to track separately the compatibility and composition of the package and that is is not possible to use the Fix Version Jira functionalities with the new field.

 

It would be useful to have a way to group and link together the related SW releases, similar to the Merge function but that does not "cancel" the merged releases.
fields.summary: Group SW Releases

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira sometimes sends an invalid last-modified header for .css and .js files.  While this header is not required to be set (or set validly) for regular functioning of Jira, it is part of http-standards compliance, specifically for caching software to use.  Sending an invalid header is known to cause problems with specific proxy/caching software.
h3. Environment

Observed in:
 * Jira 8.13.7
 * Jira 8.13.10
 * Jira 8.15.1
 * Jira 8.20.1
 * Confluence

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Run Jira 8.13+
 # Connect to Jira over IBM Webseal proxy

h3. Expected Results

Pages will load as expected.
h3. Actual Results

Jira pages load, but do not load/display completely.  Page styling is missing, for example.  (.css and .js are failing to load)

Get requests for .css and .js components will have the Response header Last-Modified set to:
{code:java}
Wed, 31 Dec 1969 23:59:59 GMT{code}
Since this is one second before the beginning of Unix Time (Thu, 01 Jan 1970 00:00:00 GMT), Webseal will fail to calculate whether the cache should be refreshed and will return an error code instead of content.
h3. Workaround

Disable cache-control in Webseal. For more information on Content Caching & the Last Modified Header in Webseal, see this IBM article: [Content Caching in IBM Webseal|https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/sva/9.0.1?topic=configuration-content-caching]
fields.summary: Jira should send valid last-modified headers for .css & .js

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira Toolkit, a popular Atlassian Labs plugin contains two custom fields, AuthorOfLastUpdateOrComment and Participants. Calculation of values for these two fields has performance impact in cases when the issue has a lot of comments. The direct reason for that is that each processed comment causes a user lookup in Jira {{CommentSearchManager.java}} code.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Run any action that involves generation of JSON representation of the issue.

h3. Expected Results

The amount of calls to user subsystem is equal to the amount of unique participants in the issue.

h3. Actual Results
The amount of calls to user subsystem is more than twice bigger than the amount of comments on the issue.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Calculating the values of AuthorOfLastUpdateOrComment and Participants custom fields takes a long time to complete

fields.description:
Dear JPM Team,

We would like to suggest the enhancement of notifications in Jira. Just like there is in Confluence for when you f.e. are mentioned in a Jira ticket.  
These handy notifications would be very effective in Jira projects and Jira Service Management / Service Desk. And it will save a lot of e-mail traffic if you have this as an option, next to the e-mail option.
We know that there is a plugin, but why not provide this as a standard?

So our suggestions are:
 * Notifications about when the assignee changes or is set to yourself by someone else
 * Notifications when you are mentioned or something changes in the issue/ticket
 * The same kind of bell/balloon as in Confluence for all the notifications in Jira

!image-2021-10-26-14-44-18-138.png!

 

Thank you and kind regards,
Joa Noya@Mention someone by typing their name...
fields.summary: Jira Notifications

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When restoring the index from another node, the index-fixer process checks the last 24h for issues that aren't in the index already, and reindex them.

When the index snapshot is from a node that has just run a full-locked reindex, the index-fixer will reindex all issues updated in the last 24h, in a single-threaded process.
While this process happens, the index replication is kept on hold.
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Stop all nodes
# Start 1 node
# Run a full locked reindex
# Start a second node

h3. Expected Results
After getting the index snapshot from the first node, the node should operate normally in a short time.

h3. Actual Results
If there were many issue updates in the last 24 hours, the node will become usable, but the issue replication takes a long time to start.

During this time, we see the index-fixer process stuck at 60%, at the {{atlassian-jira.log}}:
{code}
2021-10-22 05:58:41,181 ClusterMessageHandlerServiceThread:thread-1 INFO      [c.a.j.index.ha.DefaultIndexRecoveryManager] [INDEX-FIXER] Recovering search indexes - 60% complete... [INDEX-FIXER] Re-indexing issues modified in the last {1 days, 0 hours, 2 minutes, and 38 seconds}. (Versioning short-circuit checks are enabled.)
{code}

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Restoring an index snapshot after a full re-index might trigger the index fixer, delaying the node start up

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Issue related to the paths in REST API docs for the recent Jira Server versions.

 # Step 1: go to REST API docs of the affected version, eg. [https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/8.18.2/]

h3. Expected Results

 * example: GET /rest/api/2/mypermissions

h3. Actual Results
 * endpoint paths are not valid - `api/2` is missing
 * example: GET /rest/mypermissions

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Paths in REST API docs are invalid

fields.description:
Affected versions of Atlassian Jira Server and Data Center allow authenticated yet non-administrator remote attackers to edit the File Replication settings via a Broken Access Control vulnerability in the `ReplicationSettings!default.jspa` endpoint.

The affected versions are before version 8.6.0, from version 8.7.0 before 8.13.12, and from version 8.14.0 before 8.20.1.

*Affected versions:*

 * version < 8.6.0
 * 8.7.0 ≤ version < 8.13.12
 * 8.14.0 ≤ version < 8.20.1

*Fixed versions:*

 * 8.6.0
 * 8.13.12
 * 8.20.1
 * 8.21.0
fields.summary: Non-administrators can edit the File Replication settings - CVE-2021-41308

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using a translated Insight custom field in a JQL filter using iqlFunction() returns no results

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have an Insight Object custom field
 # Translate this field into another language, for example Czech 
 # Specify user language preference to the translated language
 # Search for issues with a JQL filter including that translated field and an {{iqlFunction()}}, for example:

{code}
project = ABCD and issuetype = "Task" and "My Translated Insight Custom Field" in iqlFunction("anyAttribute = potato")
{code}

h3. Expected Results

Search results are displayed

h3. Actual Results

Search results are not displayed. However, if user language is changed back to English, results are displayed.

h3. Workaround

Use the ID of the custom field instead of the field name in the JQL filter. For example {{customfield_12345}}. Note that this is only a partial workaround and creates an administrative burden, as non-admin users will not be able to identify the field ID without admin assistance.
fields.summary: Using a translated Insight custom field in a JQL filter using iqlFunction() returns no results

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
On the [Supported platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/supported-platforms-938846830.html] page we inform what are the database engines and versions supported by Jira.

Sometimes there may be questions on the actual version supported for a DB engine as each of them has a different versioning policy.
This may lead to some confusion on whether or not we support minor versions on the supported major versions we advertise as supported.

As an example, we support PostgreSQL 12.
It may not be straightforward from the document that any minor version is supported.


h3. Suggested Solution
It would be important to add the information that any minor version is supported for each major version.
We could include links to the versioning policy of each DBMS to help administrators.
* MySQL: [https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/8.0/en/which-version.html]
* PostgreSQL: [https://www.postgresql.org/support/versioning/]
* SQL Server: [https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/troubleshoot/sql/general/determine-version-edition-update-level]
* Oracle: _?_
fields.summary: Include versioning policy information about databases on the supported platforms page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Writing a large JQL that includes 10,000 characters makes the JQL area large and hides the results beneath.
A screenshot for reference:
 !Screenshot 2021-10-21 at 5.28.52 PM.png|thumbnail! 
However, reducing the Zoom of the browser shows the issues under the JQL query, but, this makes it difficult to read for naked eyes.
 !Screenshot 2021-10-20 at 7.08.22 PM.png|thumbnail! 
Notice that the scroll bar does not appear even if the issues (results of the JQL) are under the JQL panel

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Write a JQL which is more than 10,000 characters that cover the screen
# Observe that issues going down the screen and then scroll bar does not adjust 

h3. Expected Results
# Fix the size of the JQL area. Larger JQL can be controlled by Scrollbar
# Adust the scroll bar for the whole page when the JQL area grows

h3. Actual Results
# JQL hides the issues when there are more characters in the query
# Scroll bar does not help to scroll down

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. However, the JQL can be broken into parts, but, that lists limited results and makes it hard to view and compare.
fields.summary: Large JQL queries cover the results and scrollbar does not come handy
